adjective.description: (of a person or action) innocent and unsuspecting.
examples: he eyed her with wide, ingenuous eyes
she's staggeringly ingenuous, or possibly very cunning indeed

origin: Late 16th century: from Latin ingenuus literally native, inborn, from in- into + an element related to gignere beget. The original sense was noble, generous, giving rise to honourably straightforward, frank, hence innocently frank (late 17th century).
